## Learning Outcomes {.smaller}

1. Learn fundamental concepts underlying multilevel modeling

2. Learn practical skills for implementing such models in R

3. Instill a sense of mastery, curiosity, and fun

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}

**What you will learn here**

- When and why MLM is needed

- Prepare a dataset for MLM

- Estimate two-level models

- Interpret random effects

- Exposure to advanced topics

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

**What you *won't* learn here**

- Advanced longitudinal models

- Advanced nested (3+ level) models

- Advanced cross-classified models

- Advanced Bayesian model estimation

- Extensions (e.g., GLMM, MSEM, GAMMs)

:::
:::


## Course Format {.smaller}

#### Lectures (1-2/week, 19 total)
- Explaining concepts and demonstrating skills
- Each is tied to one or more readings

#### Computer Labs (0-1/week, 8 total)
- Six multi-part questions to apply your new skills
- Demonstrate your understanding in controlled conditions

#### Final Project (1 week/semester, 2 total)
- Apply your new skills to real-world data you care about
- Challenge yourself to learn new things and specialize


## Course Materials {.smaller}

#### Textbooks
- **Introduction to Multilevel Modeling** \[SF\]\*<br />
  Shaw \& Flake (2021, 1E, [www.learn-mlms.com](https://www.learn-mlms.com), *free*)

- **Multilevel analysis: Techniques and applications** \[HMV\]<br />
  Hox, Moerbeek, \& van de Schoot (2017, 3E, [www.taylorfrancis.com](https://doi.org/10.4324/9781315650982), *paid*)
  
- **R for Data Science: Import, tidy, transform, visualize, and model data** \[WCG\]<br />
  Wickham, Çetinkaya-Rundel, \& Grolemund (2023, 2E, [r4ds.hadley.mz](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/), *free*)

#### R Packages
- Frequentist Model Fitting: [lme4](https://github.com/lme4/lme4/)\*, [glmmTMB](https://glmmtmb.github.io/glmmTMB)
- Bayesian Model Fitting: [rstanarm](https://mc-stan.org/rstanarm/), [brms](https://paulbuerkner.com/brms/)
- Utilities and Visualization: [easystats](https://easystats.github.io/easystats)\*, [ggeffects](https://strengejacke.github.io/ggeffects/)\*

# Course Modules

## Unit Overview

- Unit A: Getting Ready (4 weeks)

- Unit B: Fundamentals (4 weeks)

- Spring Break (1 week)

- Unit C: Nuances (3 weeks)

- Unit D: Previews (3 weeks)

## Unit A: Weeks 1–2 {.smaller}

#### Introductions and Software

- \[01a\]: Course Overview and Icebreakers

- \[01b\]: Software Install and Overview

- Readings: Syllabus, SF ⸿1

- Due: Week 01 Reflection

#### Linear Model Review

- \[02a\]: Simple and Multiple Regression

- \[02b\]: Moderation and Diagnostics

- Readings: SF ⸿2, Kelley \& Maxwell (2019)

- Due: Week 02 Reflection


## Unit A: Weeks 3–4 {.smaller}

#### Issues and Approaches

- \[03a\]: Issues with Clustered Data

- \[03b\]: Approaches to Clustered Data

- Readings: SF ⸿3, HMV ⸿1, McNeish (2016, 2023)

- Due: Week 03 Reflection

#### Getting Ready

- \[04a\]: Long Format and Pivoting

- \[04b\]: Estimation Strategies

- Readings: Wickham et al. (2023), HMV §§3.1--3.3

- Due: Week 04 Reflection


## Unit B: Weeks 5–6 {.smaller}

#### Random Intercepts

- \[05a\]: Moving to Two Levels

- \[05b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿4

- Due: Week 05 Lab Report

#### Fixed Slopes

- \[06a\]: Adding Fixed Slopes

- \[06b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿5

- Due: Week 06 Lab Report


## Unit B: Weeks 7–8 {.smaller}

#### Random Slopes

- \[07a\]: Adding Random Slopes

- \[07b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿6, HMV §§2.1--2.2, Aguinis et al. (2013)

- Due: Week 07 Lab Report

#### Analysis Strategy

- \[08a\]: Model Building and Comparison

- \[08b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: HMV §§3.4+4.1, Brown (2021)

- Due: Week 08 Lab Report


## Unit C: Weeks 9–10 {.smaller}

#### Spring Break

- \[09a\]: No Class (Break)

- \[09b\]: No Class (Break)

- Readings: *NA*

- Due: *NA*

#### Troubleshooting

- \[10a\]: Troubleshooting

- \[10b\]: No Class (Travel)

- Readings: SF ⸿7

- Due: *NA*


## Unit C: Weeks 11–12 {.smaller}

#### Centering and Decomposing

- \[11a\]: Within and Between Cluster Effects

- \[11b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿8, HMV §4.2, Hamaker \& Muthén (2020)

- Due: Week 11 Lab Report

#### Longitudinal Data

- \[12a\]: Longitudinal Data Considerations

- \[12b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿⸿ 9--10, HMV ⸿5, Hox & Boom (2012)

- Due: Week 12 Lab Report


## Unit D: Weeks 13–14 {.smaller}

#### Assumptions and Diagnostics

- \[13a\]: Assumptions and Diagnostics

- \[13b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: SF ⸿12, HMV ⸿13

- Due: Week 13 Lab Report

#### Power and Reporting

- \[14a\]: Power and Reporting

- \[14b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: HMV §§12.1--12.4, McCoach (2019)

- Due: Week 14 Lab Report


## Unit D: Weeks 15–16 {.smaller}

#### Extensions and Previews

- \[15a\]: Hierarchical Bayesian Models

- \[15b\]: Nested and Crossed Models

- Readings: HMV §§2.3--2.4 + ⸿9, Muth et al. (2018), Flores et al. (2021)

- Due: Week 15 Reflection

#### Final Project

- \[16a\]: *Computer Lab*

- \[16b\]: *Computer Lab*

- Readings: *NA*

- Due: Final Project Report
